name: David Swartz
description: GOP Ohio County (Richland County, Ohio) Commissioner David Swartz, age 66, pleaded guilty to two felony counts of sexual battery. The abuse of a girl began when she was 6 years old or younger, with the guilty plea covering a four-year period between January 2000 and January 2004. Swartz was sentenced to eight years in prison and must register as a sex offender.

name: Mark Pazuhanich
description: Mark Pazuhanich was a Monroe County, Pennsylvania judge and former district attorney. In January 2004, a 10-year-old girl testified that Pazuhanich fondled her at a Hilary Duff teen pop concert on November 29, 2003, touching her breasts and placing his hands between her legs. The fifth-grader stated she was 'touched wrong' by Pazuhanich, who admitted to being in a drunken state at the concert. On July 13, 2004, Pazuhanich pleaded no contest to the charges. He was sentenced to 10 years probation, required to register as a sex offender, and forced to resign from his judgeship. In October 2004, he was banned for life from serving as a judge, and he was disbarred as an attorney in November 2006.

name: Nicholas Morency
description: Republican anti-abortion activist Nicholas Morency from New Jersey pleaded guilty to possessing Child Sexual Abuse Material on his computer. At the same time he was collecting pornographic images of children, Morency was actively offering a $1.5 million reward on the Internet for the murder of any abortion provider. The National Abortion Federation (NAF) discovered Morency's murder-for-hire website in January 1999 and reported it to the Justice Department, which shut down the site just 24 hours later. Morency was convicted in 2001 for his combined crimes involving child pornography and incitement to violence.

name: Tom Shortridge
description: Republican campaign consultant Tom Shortridge was convicted of taking nude photographs of a 15-year-old girl. He was sentenced to three years probation and was required to register as a sex offender.

name: Mike Hintz
description: Republican pastor Mike Hintz, whom President George W. Bush publicly commended during the 2004 presidential campaign, was arrested after admitting to a sexual affair with a female juvenile. Hintz surrendered to police and was convicted of sexual misconduct with a minor.

name: Richard A. Delgaudio
description: Republican fundraiser Richard A. Delgaudio was found guilty of child pornography charges and paying two teenage girls to pose for sexual photos. He was convicted in 2003 and sentenced to prison.

name: Randal David Ankeney
description: Randal David Ankeney was a prominent Colorado Republican activist and attorney who served as a volunteer coordinator for Republican Governor Bill Owens' reelection campaign and as a regional representative for the Governor's Economic Development Office. In 2001, he was convicted of attempted sexual assault of a 13-year-old girl he had met on the Internet, getting her intoxicated on marijuana, photographing her topless, and fondling her. He served two years in prison. In September 2006, while out on bail for an adult sexual assault charge, he was arrested and charged with nine felonies including sexual assault on a child with a pattern of abuse, sexual exploitation of a child, and enticement of a child. He was sentenced to eight years in prison for sexual assault of a 14-year-old girl. Subsequently, he pleaded guilty to additional Class 4 felony charges and received a six-year sentence.

name: Jeffrey Patti
description: Republican Committee Chairman Jeffrey Patti was arrested in 2005 for distributing a video clip of a 5-year-old girl being raped. Despite the severity of the crime, authorities agreed to allow his criminal record to be expunged in just three years.
crime: distribution of child sexual abuse material

name: Howard L. Brooks
description: Howard L. Brooks was a Republican legislative aide and advisor to a California state assemblyman. He was charged in 2001 with molesting a 12-year-old boy and possession of child pornography. Brooks pleaded no contest to the charges and was sentenced to three years in prison. He is required to register as a sex offender.

name: Earl "Butch" Kimmerling
description: Earl 'Butch' Kimmerling was a Republican anti-gay activist from Indiana and a 51-year-old school bus driver. He and his wife adopted a young girl, and Kimmerling confessed in a videotaped interview to molesting the child. He was actively involved in battling a gay couple from Indianapolis who attempted to adopt the girl, receiving support from religious and political leaders in Anderson and across Indiana. Kimmerling was sentenced to 40 years in prison for molesting an 8-year-old girl. He was later paroled but violated his parole and returned to prison in 2019. During a subsequent interview, Kimmerling admitted to molesting four additional children.

name: Jeffrey Claude Bartleson
description: Jeffrey Claude Bartleson was a Republican activist and office manager for the McCain presidential campaign. In 2009, he was arrested for molesting the child of a campaign volunteer. Bartleson was convicted of child sexual abuse and sentenced to prison.

name: Stephen David Rambler
description: Stephen David Rambler is a pastor of Heritage Assembly Church on the Rock in Wrightsville, Pennsylvania. In 1995, a 19-year-old man accused Rambler of sexually molesting him for four years. In 1996, Rambler pleaded guilty to felony extortion after soliciting sexually explicit photos by placing an advertisement in a swingers magazine, then blackmailing respondents by threatening to publicly expose them unless they paid him $50. He was sentenced to 2 years probation and fined $550. Additionally, Rambler was accused of using his position to solicit explicit photos from a swingers' group and extorting money from them. York County District Attorney Stanley Rebert has been attempting to remove Rambler from his political positions due to concerns about his criminal history.

name: Fred C. Smeltzer, Jr.
description: Fred C. Smeltzer Jr. was a 32-year-old Republican borough councilman and deputy chief of Wrightsville Fire Company in Delaware. He pleaded no contest to charges that he raped a 15-year-old girl after getting her intoxicated during a camping trip with his best friend. The victim was the best friend's teenage daughter. Smeltzer was sentenced to six months in prison and six months house arrest. The Wrightsville Borough Council accepted his resignation from both positions. The victim's father stated to news outlets that he believed the sentence was too lenient for the crime.

name: Ryan Loskarn
description: Ryan Loskarn was a Republican U.S. Senator's aide who was investigated for possession of child sexual abuse material (CSAM). Facing charges, Loskarn committed suicide in 2014, taking his own life rather than face prosecution.

name: Larry Jack Schwarz
description: Larry Jack Schwarz was a Republican parole board officer and former Colorado state representative. In 2002, he was fired from his position after child pornography was discovered in his possession. Schwarz was convicted and sentenced to prison for the possession and distribution of child sexual abuse material.

name: Robin Vanderwall
description: Robin Vanderwall was the director of the Faith and Family Alliance, a Republican strategist, and a political lobbyist. In 2005, he was convicted of five counts of soliciting sex from boys and girls over the Internet. Vanderwall was sentenced to prison for his crimes involving the sexual exploitation of minors.

name: Jon Grunseth
description: Jon Grunseth is a Republican businessman from Minnesota who withdrew his candidacy for Minnesota governor in 2017 after serious allegations surfaced. Multiple women accused Grunseth of going swimming in the nude with four underage girls, including his own daughter. The scandal ended his political ambitions after details of the alleged inappropriate behavior with minors became public.

name: Nicholas Elizondo
description: Nicholas Elizondo was the director of the 'Young Republican Federation.' He molested his own 6-year-old daughter and was convicted of child sexual abuse. Elizondo was sentenced to six years in prison and is required to register as a sex offender.

name: Brent Schepp
description: Brent Schepp was a Republican County Board Candidate who was charged in 2006 with molesting a 14-year-old girl. He was convicted of child sexual abuse and sentenced to prison.

name: Randall Casseday
description: Randall Casseday was the Human Resources Director for the Washington Times, a right-wing newspaper known for regular front-page coverage of family and faith issues. Despite his position at a 'moral values' organization, Casseday was caught in an underage sex sting operation. He was arrested and charged with soliciting sex from someone he believed to be an underage minor. Casseday was convicted and sentenced to prison, representing a stark contradiction between the Washington Times' professed moral values and the actions of its own staff.
